msDesc.head: Henricus de Frimaria, Liber de perfectione spirituali interioris hominis; Sequences and Excerpts. Germany, Mainz Charterhouse: A) (fols 1–57a, 65) s. xiv2; B) (fols 57b–64) s. xivmed.

physDesc.p: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1278–1284. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

supportDesc.foliation: i, 1–65, in modern (19th-cent.) pencil; no. 57 double (fols 57a & 57b).
supportDesc.collation: A) i–v 12-2 | vi 8-1 ; A+B) vii 8 + (2-1). Fols 57b–64 = part B; fol. 65 belongs to fascicle A.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: William Laud, 1573–1645: MS. Laud Misc. 492 consists of two parts, possibly bound together at the Mainz Charterhouse; with regard to contents, however, the position of part B seems inappropriate, which might suggest that the book, in its present form, is an English production. Ex-libris inscription of Archbp. Laud, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 353–4 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 51

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1278–1284

msItem.author: Henricus de Frimaria
msItem.title: Liber de perfectione spirituali interioris hominis
msItem.note: With prologue and list of chapters (unpr.; Stroick, Friemar, 63–64; Zumkeller 323, citing the present MS. (incorrect folio no.), & 323 (addendum); Bloomfield 4705; ‘Heinrich von Friemar der Ältere’, 2VL 3 (1981) 730–37, at col. 731 [R. G. Warnock]).

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De civitate dei I.8
msItem.note: Extract, 1. 8 (ed.: PL 41. 20–21; ed. E. Hoffmann, CSEL 40, 1 (1899) 13, l. 23–14, l. 24; B. Dombart & A. Kalb, CCSL 47 (1955) 7, l. 15–8, l. 43; – CPL 313).

supportDesc.support: parchment, palmimpsested; most of remaining text is preserved on fols 55v & 65v, written at right angles to the upper text: Hebrew letters in brown ink visible, however not enough to properly identify the text; not all leaves show erasure.
supportDesc.collation: A) i–v 12-2 | vi 8-1 ; A+B) vii 8 + (2-1). Fols 57b–64 = part B; fol. 65 belongs to fascicle A.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in lead point; one column of 36–39 lines. Ruled space
c.141–51 99–103

handDesc.handNote: Mainz Charterhouse, s. xiv2, by mainly two hands, changing at fols 40v/41r (quires iv/v); hand A1 writes an early compressed bastarda, hand A2 textualis. A hand s. xv from the Charterhouse added item 5 on fol. 65v, in bastarda. A few marginal corrections and annotations in the text hands and in other contemporary hands from the Mainz Charterhouse.

origin.origPlace: Germany, Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: part A is vacant of any ex-libris inscription, but likely copied at Mainz Charterhouse to judge from script and parchment.

msItem.title: Theological extracts
msItem.note: See printed catalogue for full listing.

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Ad Rusticum monachum (ep. 125) (extract)
msItem.note: 15 (ed.: PL 22. 1080–81; ed. I. Hilberg, CSEL 56/1 (21996) 134, ll. 2–5; CPL 620); text slightly different from ed.

supportDesc.support: paper; remnants of a watermark visible at the top centre of fol. 59: the lower part of a chalice, with a stem (?), tilted towards the left. (fols 57b & 64) A parchment slip hooked around the paper quire.
supportDesc.collation: A+B) vii 8 + (2-1). Fols 57b–64 = part B; fol. 65 belongs to fascicle A.

layoutDesc.layout:
(fols 57br–v & 64r, parchment slip) Ruling in lead point; one column of 16 or 17 lines. (fol. 64v) no ruling. Ruled space
c.65–70 113–15

(fols 58–63, paper quire) Ruling in lead point; one column of 23-24 lines. Ruled space
c.155–59 116–20

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, likely Mainz Charterhouse, s. xivmed, by several hands: B1) (fol. 57br–v) item 2; B2) (fol. 64r) item 4; B3) (fols 58–63, the whole paper quire) item 3. A few marginal annotations in the text hands, (fols 58r & 63r) two notes in a hand of s. xivex from the Mainz Charterhouse, (fol. 63r).

origin.origPlace: Germany, likely Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the head of fol. 58r: ‘Iste liber est domus montis sancti michaelis prope mogunciam ordinis Cartusiensium’.

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
